Homemade Mac and Cheese with Bacon

Jump to Recipe

Get ready to indulge in the ultimate comfort food with our Homemade Mac and Cheese with Bacon recipe! This creamy, cheesy delight combines the classic taste of macaroni and cheese with the savory goodness of crispy bacon, creating a dish that's not only satisfying but also packed with flavor. Perfect for a cozy family dinner or a potluck gathering, this mac and cheese is sure to impress both kids and adults alike. With simple ingredients like elbow macaroni, sharp cheddar cheese, and crispy bacon, you'll have a mouthwatering meal on the table in no time. Plus, our step-by-step guide makes it easy for anyone to whip up this delicious homemade version. Let’s dive into this irresistible recipe that will elevate your mac and cheese game to a whole new level!

Ingredients

elbow macaroni

Use whole wheat elbow macaroni for added fiber or gluten-free pasta if needed. Cook until al dente for the best texture.

cheddar cheese

Opt for sharp cheddar for a bolder flavor or mix in some Gruyere or Monterey Jack for a creamier texture. Always shred your cheese from a block rather than using pre-shredded for better melting.

milk

You can substitute whole milk with half-and-half for a richer sauce or use almond milk for a dairy-free option. Warm the milk slightly before adding to the sauce to help it combine better.

butter

For a healthier option, use olive oil or a plant-based butter. Clarified butter can also enhance the flavor profile.

all-purpose flour

If you're gluten-free, substitute with cornstarch or a gluten-free flour blend. A light toasting of the flour in the butter before adding milk can enhance the nutty flavor.

bacon

Turkey bacon or pancetta can be used as substitutes. For a vegetarian option, consider adding smoked paprika or liquid smoke to mimic the bacon flavor.

salt

Adjust the salt according to your taste preference, especially if using salted butter or cheese. You can also try seasoning with garlic powder for added depth.

black pepper

Freshly cracked black pepper enhances the flavor better than pre-ground. For a kick, try adding cayenne pepper or crushed red pepper flakes.

paprika

Smoked paprika can add a wonderful depth of flavor. If you prefer a milder dish, use sweet paprika instead.

Cooking Steps

  • Step 1: Cook the Elbow Macaroni

    Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add 2 cups of elbow macaroni and cook according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain the pasta in a colander and set aside.

  • Step 2: Melt the Butter

    In a large saucepan over medium heat, melt 4 tablespoons of butter until fully melted and bubbly. Be careful not to let it brown.

  • Step 3: Make the Roux

    Once the butter is melted, add 1/4 cup of all-purpose flour to the pan. Stir continuously for about 1 minute until the mixture is smooth and starts to bubble, forming a roux. This step is crucial for a creamy cheese sauce.

  • Step 4: Add the Milk

    Gradually whisk in 2 cups of milk into the roux, stirring constantly to prevent lumps from forming. Continue to cook and stir until the mixture thickens and is smooth, about 5-7 minutes.

  • Step 5: Incorporate the Cheese and Seasonings

    Reduce the heat to low and add 2 cups of shredded cheddar cheese, 1/2 teaspoon of salt, 1/4 teaspoon of black pepper, and 1/4 teaspoon of paprika. Stir until the cheese is fully melted and the sauce is creamy.

  • Step 6: Combine Pasta and Cheese Sauce

    Add the cooked elbow macaroni to the cheese sauce and mix well until the pasta is fully coated. This will be the base of your mac and cheese.

  • Step 7: Add the Bacon

    Fold in 4 slices of cooked and crumbled bacon into the mac and cheese. Make sure the bacon is evenly distributed throughout the dish.

  • Step 8: Serve Hot

    Transfer the mac and cheese to bowls or a serving dish and enjoy while hot. Optionally, you can sprinkle extra cheese or bacon on top for garnish.

Frequently Asked Questions

How do I cook elbow macaroni properly?

Bring a large pot of salted water to a boil. Add the elbow macaroni and cook according to the package instructions, usually around 7-8 minutes, until al dente. Stir occasionally to prevent sticking. Drain and set aside.

What is the best way to melt butter without burning it?

Melt butter over medium heat, and keep an eye on it. If you see it starting to brown, lower the heat. Stir it gently to ensure even melting.

How can I tell when my cheese sauce has thickened?

The cheese sauce should coat the back of a spoon. When you run your finger through the sauce on the spoon, it should leave a clear line. This usually takes about 5-7 minutes of whisking after adding the milk.

Is it necessary to use all-purpose flour in the cheese sauce?

Yes, the flour helps to thicken the sauce and create a creamy texture. If you need a gluten-free option, you can use cornstarch mixed with a little cold water instead.

How can I avoid lumps in my cheese sauce?

Whisk continuously while gradually adding the milk to the butter and flour mixture. This helps to create a smooth sauce. If lumps do form, you can use an immersion blender to smooth it out.

What’s the best way to cook bacon for this recipe?

Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crispy, about 5-7 minutes. Place cooked bacon on paper towels to drain excess grease, then crumble it for your mac and cheese.

How can I make my mac and cheese extra creamy?

Use a combination of cheeses for flavor and creaminess, such as a mix of cheddar and cream cheese or mozzarella. You can also add a splash of cream instead of some milk.

What can I add to enhance the flavor of my mac and cheese?

You can add spices like garlic powder, onion powder, or mustard powder for extra flavor. For toppings, consider breadcrumbs, more cheese, or even sautéed vegetables.

Can I make this recipe ahead of time?

Yes! You can prepare the mac and cheese and store it in the refrigerator for up to 2 days. Reheat in the oven or microwave, adding a little milk to keep it creamy.

What are some safety tips for cooking in the kitchen?

Always use oven mitts when handling hot pots and pans. Keep sharp knives away from the edge of the counter and use a cutting board. Wash your hands after handling raw ingredients.

Additional Information

Dietary Considerations

For those with dietary restrictions, consider using gluten-free macaroni and a gluten-free flour blend to make the dish suitable for gluten-sensitive individuals. For a lighter version, you could substitute the whole milk with almond milk or another plant-based milk and use a reduced-fat cheese option. To make it vegetarian, simply omit the bacon or replace it with a smoked tempeh or mushroom alternative for a similar umami flavor.

Pairings

For a delightful meal, pair the Homemade Mac and Cheese with Bacon with a side of steamed broccoli or a fresh garden salad to add some color and nutrition. A crispy baguette or garlic bread complements this dish beautifully. As for beverages, consider serving a chilled lager or a light-bodied red wine, such as Pinot Noir, which has enough acidity to cut through the richness of the cheese. For a non-alcoholic option, a sparkling lemonade or iced tea works wonderfully.

Serving Suggestions

Serve the Mac and Cheese in individual ramekins for a rustic presentation, topped with extra crumbled bacon and a sprinkle of chopped chives or parsley for a pop of color. For a fun twist, you can bake the mac and cheese in the oven with a breadcrumb topping for added crunch and serve it in a cast-iron skillet for a warm, homestyle feel. This dish is best enjoyed hot, straight from the pot or oven, to appreciate its creamy texture and flavors.

Description

Creamy, cheesy pasta topped with crispy bacon for a delicious comfort dish!

Ingredients

  • elbow macaroni: 2 cups
  • cheddar cheese: 2 cups, shredded
  • milk: 2 cups
  • butter: 4 tablespoons
  • all-purpose flour: 1/4 cup
  • bacon: 4 slices, cooked and crumbled
  • salt: 1/2 teaspoon
  • black pepper: 1/4 teaspoon
  • paprika: 1/4 teaspoon
